unit_learning_outcomes.description: Compare predictive modelling techniques to select an appropriate method for a stated situation and perform predictive modelling for a given set of data.
Explain the key iterative steps involved in building a model (business understanding, data understanding and preparation, modelling, evaluation, communication and deployment).
Use a range of perspectives (statistical techniques and measures, business context and objectives etc.) to evaluate the appropriateness of a model.
Develop solutions to analytical problems in research contexts.

Describe the various stages in data
understanding and preparation and apply these skills within the context of practical problems.
Communicate modelling results to a range of business decision making audiences, taking into account the audience’s needs and relating findings back to the original business objectives.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Further article readings will form part of the learning resources to develop research skills relevant to actuarial research topics
Preparation for seminar and various assessment items.
Further article readings will form part of the learning resources to supplement lecture notes.

assessments.description: The final examination will be closed book, a three-hour written paper with ten minutes reading time, to be held during the University Examination period.
Students will work on two individual case studies.
Students will be required to write up a report (word limit of up to 5000 words) based on a project.

academic_org.value: Department of Actuarial Studies and Business Analytics

data.description: This unit covers advanced tools and techniques in data analytics and modern applied research. Students will be taught how to apply these skills in a range of business environments and will be able to contribute to all stages of developing solutions to analytical problems across multiple industries, domains and research contexts. This unit has a focus on practical application using a variety of real-life case studies. Students gaining a grade of credit or higher in this unit are eligible for exemption from the Data Analytics Principles subject of the Actuary program of the Actuaries Institute.
data.title: Actuarial Data Analytics

title: Actuarial Data Analytics
